pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.0.1.eng: Homage to the Buddha, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.0.2.pli: Ime kho panāyasmanto dvenavuti pācittiyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.0.2.eng: Venerables, these ninety-two rules on confession come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena hatthako sakyaputto vādakkhitto hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.2.eng: Hatthaka the Sakyan was beaten in debate.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.3.pli: So titthiyehi saddhiṃ sallapanto avajānitvā paṭijānāti, paṭijānitvā avajānāti, aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati, sampajānamusā bhāsati, saṅketaṃ katvā visaṃvādeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.3.eng: While talking with the monastics of other religions, he would assert things after denying them, and he would deny things after asserting them. He evaded the issues, lied, and made sham appointments.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.3.comm: Sp 2.1: Purebhattādīsu, “asukasmiṁ nāma kāle asukasmiṁ nāma padese vādo hotū”ti saṅketaṁ katvā saṅketato pure vā pacchā vā gantvā, “passatha bho, titthiyā na āgatā parājitā”ti pakkamati, “Before the meal, etc., he would make an appointment, saying, ‘Let there be a debate at such-and-such a time and at such-and-such a place,’ and he would then go there before or after the time of the appointment, saying, ‘Look, sirs, the ascetics of other religions have not come; they are defeated’, and he would then depart.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.4.pli: Titthiyā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—“kathañhi nāma hatthako sakyaputto amhehi saddhiṃ sallapanto avajānitvā paṭijānissati, paṭijānitvā avajānissati, aññenaññaṃ paṭicarissati, sampajānamusā bhāsissati, saṅketaṃ katvā visaṃvādessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.4.eng: The monastics of other religions complained and criticized him, “When Hatthaka talks with us, how can he assert things after denying them, deny things after asserting them, evade the issues, lie, and make sham appointments?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ titthiyānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.5.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those monastics of other religions.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū yena hatthako sakyaputto tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā hatthakaṃ sakyaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.6.eng: They then went to Hatthaka and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, āvuso hatthaka, titthiyehi saddhiṃ sallapanto avajānitvā paṭijānāsi, paṭijānitvā avajānāsi, aññenaññaṃ paṭicarasi, sampajānamusā bhāsasi, saṅketaṃ katvā visaṃvādesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.7.eng: “Is it true, Hatthaka, that you’re doing this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.8.pli: “Ete kho, āvuso, titthiyā nāma yena kenaci jetabbā;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.8.eng: “These monastics of other religions should be beaten, whatever it takes!

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.9.eng: They shouldn’t be allowed to win.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.10.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.10.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma hatthako sakyaputto titthiyehi saddhiṃ sallapanto avajānitvā paṭijānissati, paṭijānitvā avajānissati, aññenaññaṃ paṭicarissati, sampajānamusā bhāsissati, saṅketaṃ katvā visaṃvādessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.11.eng: “When Hatthaka talks with the monastics of other religions, how can he assert things after denying them, deny things after asserting them, evade the issues, lie, and make sham appointments?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.12.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū hatthakaṃ sakyaputtaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.12.eng: After rebuking Hatthaka in many ways, they told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā hatthakaṃ sakyaputtaṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.13.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Hatthaka:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.14.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, hatthaka, titthiyehi saddhiṃ sallapanto avajānitvā paṭijānāsi, paṭijānitvā avajānāsi, aññenaññaṃ paṭicarasi, sampajānamusā bhāsasi, saṅketaṃ katvā visaṃvādesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.14.eng: “Is it true, Hatthaka, that you’re doing this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.17.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, titthiyehi saddhiṃ sallapanto avajānitvā paṭijānissasi, paṭijānitvā avajānissasi, aññenaññaṃ paṭicarissasi, sampajānamusā bhāsissasi, saṅketaṃ katvā visaṃvādessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.17.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.19.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.19.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:1.20.1.eng: ‘If a monk lies in full awareness, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.1.2.pli: visaṃvādanapurekkhārassa vācā, girā, byappatho, vacībhedo, vācasikā viññatti, aṭṭha anariyavohārā—adiṭṭhaṃ diṭṭhaṃ meti, assutaṃ sutaṃ meti, amutaṃ mutaṃ meti, aviññātaṃ viññātaṃ meti, diṭṭhaṃ adiṭṭhaṃ meti, sutaṃ assutaṃ meti, mutaṃ amutaṃ meti, viññātaṃ aviññātaṃ meti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.1.2.eng: the speech of one who is aiming to deceive—his words, his way of speaking, his breaking into speech, his verbal expression, his eight kinds of ignoble speech: he says that he has seen what he has not seen; he says that he has heard what he has not heard; he says that he has sensed what he has not sensed; he says that he has mentally experienced what he has not mentally experienced; he says that he has not seen what he has seen; he says that he has not heard what he has heard; he says that he has not sensed what he has sensed; he says that he has not mentally experienced what he has mentally experienced.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.1.2.comm: Although muta means “thought”, translating it as “sensed” is necessary in light of the definitions below. As for aviññāta, “not mentally experienced”, the commentary at Sp 2.3 says: Aññatra pañcahi indriyehi suddhena viññāṇeneva aggahitaṁ aviññātanti veditabbaṁ, “Aviññāta is to be understood as what is grasped by mere consciousness apart from the five senses.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.1.8.pli: na ghānena ghāyitaṃ, na jivhāya sāyitaṃ, na kāyena phuṭṭhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.1.8.eng: not smelled with the nose, not tasted with the tongue, not touched with the body.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.1.10.eng: not mentally experienced with the mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.1.16.pli: ghānena ghāyitaṃ, jivhāya sāyitaṃ, kāyena phuṭṭhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.1.16.eng: smelled with the nose, tasted with the tongue, touched with the body.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.0.2.eng: Falsely claiming to have experienced what he has not experienced: a single sense door

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.1.pli: Tīhākārehi “adiṭṭhaṃ diṭṭhaṃ me”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.1.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has seen what he has not seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.2.pli: pubbevassa hoti “musā bhaṇissan”ti, bhaṇantassa hoti “musā bhaṇāmī”ti, bhaṇitassa hoti “musā mayā bhaṇitan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.2.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie; while lying, he knows he is lying; after he has lied, he knows he has lied.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.3.pli: Catūhākārehi “adiṭṭhaṃ diṭṭhaṃ me”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.3.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has seen what he has not seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when four conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.4.pli: pubbevassa hoti “musā bhaṇissan”ti, bhaṇantassa hoti “musā bhaṇāmī”ti, bhaṇitassa hoti “musā mayā bhaṇitan”ti, vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.4.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie; while lying, he knows he is lying; after he has lied, he knows he has lied; he misrepresents his view of what is true.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.4.comm: “Of what is true” is not in the Pali, but has been added for clarity.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.5.pli: Pañcahākārehi “adiṭṭhaṃ diṭṭhaṃ me”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.5.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has seen what he has not seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when five conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.6.pli: pubbevassa hoti “musā bhaṇissan”ti, bhaṇantassa hoti “musā bhaṇāmī”ti, bhaṇitassa hoti “musā mayā bhaṇitan”ti, vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ, vinidhāya khantiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.6.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie; while lying, he knows he is lying; after he has lied, he knows he has lied; he misrepresents his view of what is true; he misrepresents his belief of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.7.pli: Chahākārehi “adiṭṭhaṃ diṭṭhaṃ me”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.7.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has seen what he has not seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when six conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.8.pli: pubbevassa hoti “musā bhaṇissan”ti, bhaṇantassa hoti “musā bhaṇāmī”ti, bhaṇitassa hoti “musā mayā bhaṇitan”ti, vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ, vinidhāya khantiṃ, vinidhāya ruciṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.8.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie; while lying, he knows he is lying; after he has lied, he knows he has lied; he misrepresents his view of what is true; he misrepresents his belief of what is true; he misrepresents his acceptance of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.9.pli: Sattahākārehi “adiṭṭhaṃ diṭṭhaṃ me”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.9.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has seen what he has not seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when seven conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.10.pli: pubbevassa hoti “musā bhaṇissan”ti, bhaṇantassa hoti “musā bhaṇāmī”ti, bhaṇitassa hoti “musā mayā bhaṇitan”ti, vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ, vinidhāya khantiṃ, vinidhāya ruciṃ, vinidhāya bhāvaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.10.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie; while lying, he knows he is lying; after he has lied, he knows he has lied; he misrepresents his view of what is true; he misrepresents his belief of what is true; he misrepresents his acceptance of what is true; he misrepresents his sentiment of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.11.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he says that he has heard what he has not heard …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.12.eng: saying that he has sensed what he has not sensed …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.13.pli: aviññātaṃ viññātaṃ meti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.13.eng: saying that he has mentally experienced what he has not mentally experienced, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.14.pli: pubbevassa hoti “musā bhaṇissan”ti, bhaṇantassa hoti “musā bhaṇāmī”ti, bhaṇitassa hoti “musā mayā bhaṇitan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.14.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie; while lying, he knows he is lying; after he has lied, he knows he has lied.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.18.pli: sattahākārehi “aviññātaṃ viññātaṃ me”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.18.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced what he has not mentally experienced, he commits an offense entailing confession when seven conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.19.pli: pubbevassa hoti “musā bhaṇissan”ti, bhaṇantassa hoti “musā bhaṇāmī”ti, bhaṇitassa hoti “musā mayā bhaṇitan”ti, vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ, vinidhāya khantiṃ, vinidhāya ruciṃ, vinidhāya bhāvaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.2.19.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie; while lying, he knows he is lying; after he has lied, he knows he has lied; he misrepresents his view of what is true; he misrepresents his belief of what is true; he misrepresents his acceptance of what is true; he misrepresents his sentiment of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.0.eng: Falsely claiming to have experienced what he has not experienced: multiple sense doors

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.1.pli: Tīhākārehi “adiṭṭhaṃ diṭṭhañca me sutañcā”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.1.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has seen and heard what he has not seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.2.pli: tīhākārehi “adiṭṭhaṃ diṭṭhañca me mutañcā”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.2.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has seen and sensed what he has not seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.3.pli: tīhākārehi “adiṭṭhaṃ diṭṭhañca me viññātañcā”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.3.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has seen and mentally experienced what he has not seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.4.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has seen and heard and sensed what he has not seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.5.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has seen and heard and mentally experienced what he has not seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.6.pli: tīhākārehi adiṭṭhaṃ “diṭṭhañca me sutañca mutañca viññātañcā”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.6.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has seen and heard and sensed and mentally experienced what he has not seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.6.comm: The combination “… saying that he has seen and sensed and mentally experienced what he has not seen …” is missing. The corresponding combination is missing from the next three series of permutations, ending at Bu Pc 1:2.3.12, Bu Pc 1:2.3.18, and Bu Pc 1:2.3.24.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.7.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has heard and sensed what he has not heard, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.8.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has heard and mentally experienced what he has not heard, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.9.pli: tīhākārehi assutaṃ “sutañca me diṭṭhañcā”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.9.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has heard and seen what he has not heard, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.10.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has heard and sensed and mentally experienced what he has not heard, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.11.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has heard and sensed and seen what he has not heard, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.12.pli: tīhākārehi assutaṃ “sutañca me mutañca viññātañca diṭṭhañcā”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.12.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has heard and sensed and mentally experienced and seen what he has not heard, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.13.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has sensed and mentally experienced what he has not sensed, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.14.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has sensed and seen what he has not sensed, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.15.pli: tīhākārehi amutaṃ “mutañca me sutañcā”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.15.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has sensed and heard what he has not sensed, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.16.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has sensed and mentally experienced and seen what he has not sensed, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.17.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has sensed and mentally experienced and heard what he has not sensed, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.18.pli: tīhākārehi amutaṃ “mutañca me viññātañca diṭṭhañca sutañcā”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.18.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has sensed and mentally experienced and seen and heard what he has not sensed, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.19.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and seen what he has not mentally experienced, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.20.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and heard what he has not mentally experienced, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.21.pli: tīhākārehi aviññātaṃ “viññātañca me mutañcā”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.21.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and sensed what he has not mentally experienced, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.22.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and seen and heard what he has not mentally experienced, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.23.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and seen and sensed what he has not mentally experienced, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.24.pli: tīhākārehi aviññātaṃ “viññātañca me diṭṭhañca sutañca mutañcā”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.3.24.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and seen and heard and sensed what he has not mentally experienced, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.4.0.eng: Falsely claiming not to have experienced what he has experienced

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.4.1.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has not seen what he has seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.4.2.eng: saying that he has not heard what he has heard …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.4.3.eng: saying that he has not sensed what he has sensed …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.4.4.pli: viññātaṃ “aviññātaṃ me”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.4.4.eng: saying that he has not mentally experienced what he has mentally experienced, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.5.0.eng: Falsely claiming to have experienced with one sense what he has experienced with another

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.5.1.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has heard what he has seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.5.2.eng: saying that he has sensed what he has seen …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.5.3.pli: tīhākārehi diṭṭhaṃ “viññātaṃ me”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.5.4.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying that he has heard and sensed what he has seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.5.5.eng: saying that he has heard and mentally experienced what he has seen …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.5.6.pli: tīhākārehi diṭṭhaṃ “sutañca me mutañca viññātañcā”ti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.5.6.eng: saying that he has heard and sensed and mentally experienced what he seen, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.5.6.comm: The combination “… saying that he has sensed and mentally experienced what he has seen …” is missing. The corresponding combination is missing from the next three series of permutations, ending at Bu Pc 1:2.5.12, Bu Pc 1:2.5.18, and Bu Pc 1:2.5.24.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.5.24.eng: saying that he has seen and heard and sensed what he mentally experienced, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.1.pli: Tīhākārehi diṭṭhe vematiko diṭṭhaṃ nokappeti, diṭṭhaṃ nassarati, diṭṭhaṃ pamuṭṭho hoti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.1.eng: If he is unsure of what he has seen, has doubts about what he has seen, does not remember what he has seen, is confused about what he has seen …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.2.pli: sute vematiko sutaṃ nokappeti, sutaṃ nassarati, sutaṃ pamuṭṭho hoti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.2.eng: If he is unsure of what he has heard, has doubts about what he has heard, does not remember what he has heard, is confused about what he has heard …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.3.pli: mute vematiko mutaṃ nokappeti, mutaṃ nassarati, mutaṃ pamuṭṭho hoti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.3.eng: If he is unsure of what he has sensed, has doubts about what he has sensed, does not remember what he has sensed, is confused about what he has sensed …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.4.pli: viññāte vematiko viññātaṃ nokappeti, viññātaṃ nassarati, viññātaṃ pamuṭṭho hoti … viññātañca me diṭṭhañcāti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.4.eng: If he is unsure of what he has mentally experienced, has doubts about what he has mentally experienced, does not remember what he has mentally experienced, is confused about what he has mentally experienced, but he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and seen …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.5.pli: viññātaṃ pamuṭṭho hoti … viññātañca me sutañcāti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.5.eng: is confused about what he has mentally experienced, but he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and heard …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.6.pli: viññātaṃ pamuṭṭho hoti; viññātañca me mutañcāti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.6.eng: is confused about what he has mentally experienced, but he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and sensed …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.7.pli: viññātaṃ pamuṭṭho hoti; viññātañca me diṭṭhañca sutañcāti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.7.eng: is confused about what he has mentally experienced, but he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and seen and heard …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.8.pli: viññātaṃ pamuṭṭho hoti; viññātañca me diṭṭhañca mutañcāti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.8.eng: is confused about what he has mentally experienced, but he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and seen and sensed …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.9.pli: viññātaṃ pamuṭṭho hoti; viññātañca me diṭṭhañca sutañca mutañcāti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.9.eng: is confused about what he has mentally experienced, but he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and seen and heard and sensed, he commits an offense entailing confession when three conditions are fulfilled …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.9.comm: The series that ends here is also missing one combination: “… saying that he has mentally experienced and heard and sensed what he has seen …”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.13.pli: sattahākārehi …pe… viññātaṃ pamuṭṭho hoti, viññātañca me diṭṭhañca sutañca mutañcāti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pācittiyassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.13.eng: is confused about what he has mentally experienced, but he lies in full awareness, saying that he has mentally experienced and seen and heard and sensed, he commits an offense entailing confession when seven conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.14.pli: pubbevassa hoti “musā bhaṇissan”ti, bhaṇantassa hoti “musā bhaṇāmī”ti, bhaṇitassa hoti “musā mayā bhaṇitan”ti, vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ, vinidhāya khantiṃ, vinidhāya ruciṃ, vinidhāya bhāvaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.6.14.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie; while lying, he knows he is lying; after he has lied, he knows he has lied; he misrepresents his view of what is true; he misrepresents his belief of what is true; he misrepresents his acceptance of what is true; he misrepresents his sentiment of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.7.7.eng: meaning to say one thing, he says something else.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.7.9.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc1:2.7.10.eng: The training rule on lying, the first, is finished.
